issue.title: [C++] Substrait consumer fails to compile on older Ubuntu
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-17426](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17426). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The Ubuntu 18 nightly test is failing to compiler the Substrait consumer.  This is probably due to an older version of protoc.  Example: https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/runs/7830373122?check_suite_focus=true

We should make sure we are using protobuf in a way that is compatible with older protoc.
